page.title: 15The River Maun Landscape 1
page.content: Over seventy-five percent of the land cover is given over to cultivated fields and either deciduous tree cover, or coniferous plantations. It is valuable agricultural land which has a deep seated history. Records show there was a farming manor at Clipstone in 1086. Between 1817 and 1839 the floor of the Maun Valley was levelled and a unique flood dyke system was established. Unfortunately mining subsidence upset the levels and the flood dykes are out of operation. Efforts to restore the beauty of the valley have involved moving hundreds of tons of earth to landscape it. A private campsite at one end of the valley set amidst private parkland and lakes is an example of such ventures.
